messages.title: VOTE FOR CHANGE ON THURSDAY
messages.content: Where we live should not dictate whether we get the change we voted for.

messages.title: 3 THINGS TO REMEMBER
messages.content:
1. Britain needs a stable and decisive government, not a hung parliament.
2. Only a vote for Angie Bray in [constituency] will kick out [otherPartyLeaderCandidate].
3. Make your voice heard. Vote by 10pm on Thursday.

messages.title: 3 POSITIVE REASONS TO VOTE FOR CHANGE ON THURSDAY
messages.content:
1. Vote for a strong NHS, fair pensions and a cap on immigration.
2. Vote to secure your finances with no more stealth taxes and a freeze on council tax.
3. Vote for clean, honest politics and Action not words on the environment.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Secure finances with no more stealth taxes and a freeze on council tax.
Clean, honest politics and action not words on the environment.

issues.health: Vote for a strong NHS, fair pensions.
issues.socialWelfare: Vote for a strong NHS, fair pensions.

images.caption: Vote for your future. Vote for change.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet uses the image of David Cameron (the party leader) prominently alongside Angie Bray, with messaging focused on change and the importance of a stable government as opposed to a hung parliament. Specific stances and policies are mentioned, particularly regarding the NHS, immigration, taxes, and the environment.
